H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7015.def: = a sung dirge or lament at the death of a loved one; ◄ death of a friend or family member; ► expression of loss at one's death

H6865.def: = extremely hard type of stone that leaves sharp edges when fractured; ► can be used as knife; ≈ associated with an inflexible attitude

H3997.def: = the act of people coming towards a point of reference and gathering together

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1366.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3871.def: = flat object with a smooth surface; ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for construction or decoration

H1265.def: exact meaning unsure: = one of the evergreen trees commonly found in the Lebanon, with round leaves rather than flat; its fruit is a a mostly inedible seed-bearing, fleshy cone; ≈ regarded as one of the glorious trees of the Lebanon

H8149.def: = mountain, also known as {L:Hermon<SDBH:חֶרְמֹון>}, {L:Sion<SDBH:שִׂיאֹון>}, and {L:Sirion<SDBH:שִׂרְיֹון>}; ◄ part of the Anti-Lebanon range; located north-east of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H730.def: = evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength

H3844.def: = range of mountains; ◄ north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ► known for the {L:cedar<SDBH:אֶרֶז>} and other trees growing there

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H8650.def: = pole; ► used to carry a banner

H437.def: = a large-size tree found either alone or in clumps or forests; ◄ one of the varieties of |iQuercus|i*; ► functioned as landmarks, grave marks or gathering places; since its groves were considered sacred by Canaanites, ritual practices under them was always a temptation to Israelites, denounced in the texts as idolatry; ≈ their characteristics made them suitable symbols of a variety of attributes or attitudes

H1316.def: = region; ◄ north-east of the River {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}, ► at one time ruled by king {L:Og<SDBH:עֹוג>}, later assigned to half of the tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4880.def: = pole with a flat blade ► used to row or steer a boat through the water

H339.def: = area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

H3794.def: = nation regarded as descendants of {L:Javan<SDBH:יָוָן>}, son of {L:Japheth<SDBH:יֶפֶת>}, possibly to be identified with Greece

H7175.def: = frames, possibly consisting of two vertical poles held together with crossbars; ◄ made of wood; ► used to support a tent

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H7553.def: = cloth with decorative patterns sewn into it by hand and therefore expensive; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H8336.def: = state in which a countable entity is six in number

H4666.def: = cloth, attached to a boat ► in such a way as to catch the wind and propel the boat through the water

H5251.def: = a distinctive object in the form of a flag or board attached to a stick, or a metal device or image fitted on the end of a pole; ► normally used to identify a particular group, or as a rallying point for soldiers in war; ≈ often used figuratively to denote an example, or a person or deity that one can rely on, or something that shows the way

H8504.def: = woven material, dyed reddish-purple with a substance obtained from the murex shellfish

H713.def: = woven material, dyed reddish-purple with a substance obtained from the murex shellfish

H473.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Javan<SDBH:יָוָן>}; descendant of {L:Japheth<SDBH:יֶפֶת>}; ► regarded as the founder of a people with the same name

H4374.def: = a relatively large, flat object made out of cloth or other materials, ► used to cover another object

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H719.def: = town; ◄ located in northern Phoenicia on a small island off the coast; its people are considered descendants of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>} ({A:ABD})

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H6865.def: = extremely hard type of stone that leaves sharp edges when fractured; ► can be used as knife; ≈ associated with an inflexible attitude

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H1380.def: = town, ◄ located in Phoenicia, north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, ► and functioning as the seaport of the major city of Byblos, which used to trade with {L:Tyre<SDBH:צֹר>}

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H919.def: = state of disrepair of a construction

H591.def: = boat ◄ of a relatively large size ► that is able to sail the sea or ocean

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H4419.def: = a person who works as a member of the crew of ship or boat

H6148.def: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security

H4627.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H6539.def: = a nation and its territory, which was greatly expanded during the reign of {L:Cyrus<SDBH:כֹּורֶשׁ>} I.

H3865.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as the founder of a land and ethnic group with the same name

H6316.def: = ethnic group; ◄ regarded as descendants of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}, son of {L:Noah<SDBH:נֹחַ>}

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

H3553.def: = head covering; ◄ made of metal; ► used by soldiers for protection

H1926.def: = state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others

H719.def: = town; ◄ located in northern Phoenicia on a small island off the coast; its people are considered descendants of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>} ({A:ABD})

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H1575.def: = inhabitants of a town called Gammad, possibly to be identified with Kumidi of El-Amarna letters, a town east-northeast of Sidon

H4026.def: = relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

H7982.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver

H3308.def: = state in which the outward appearance of humans or objects is pleasing to the eye

H1270.def: = a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

H5801.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H3120.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Japheth<SDBH:יֶפֶת>}; ► considered the founder of a nation with the same name

H8422.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Japheth<SDBH:יֶפֶת>}; ► regarded as the founder of a nation bearing the same name

H4902.def: = a flexible container with an opening at the top, ◄ probably made out of leather

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H5178.def: = a reddish-brown metal, ◄ mined from the hills, ► and used, together with {L:tin<SDBH:בְּדִיל>}, for the production of bronze

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H4627.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H8425.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gomer<SDBH:גֹּמֶר>}; descendant of {L:Japheth<SDBH:יֶפֶת>}; ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H6505.def: = male or female offspring of a male donkey and a female horse (or, but less common, a male horse and a female donkey); stronger than a donkey and more resistant to diseases than horses and donkeys; infertile; usually dark brown in color; has bigger ears than the parent horse; ► used for riding and as pack animals; ≈ associated with a lack of understanding

H5801.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H1719.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Raamah<SDBH:רַעְמָה>}; descendant of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>} and {L:Cush<SDBH:כּוּשׁ>}, and brother of {L:Sheba<SDBH:שְׁבָא>}

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H339.def: = area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

H5506.def: = either the goods and products intended for trading, or the place where the trading was carried out

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H814.def: = amount of goods with monetary value exchanged between two parties ► as gift or as payment for goods

H1894.def: = a spiny tree up to 6-7 m. high; its leaves are compound, with the leaflets nearly opposite one another on the spine; it grows white flowers that hang in loose clusters, that give way to flat, papery seedpods about 6 cm long and 1 cm wide; found in Africa and locally known as zebrawood; ◄ Dalbergia melanoxylon; alternatively: = a tree which grows to 10 m. tall, with evergreen leaves; the inner part of its trunk is black; it is found in India and Sri Lanka: ◄ Diospyros ebenum; ► used by carvers, who inlay the wood with ivory

H7553.def: = cloth with decorative patterns sewn into it by hand and therefore expensive; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H948.def: = high quality woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of cloth and clothes; worn by the rich and by priests and Levites; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H7215.def: = hard stony substance secreted by certain colonial marine animals as an external skeleton, typically forming large reefs; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H3539.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = precious stone with a bright red color

H5801.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H2406.def: = cereal plant bearing dense four-sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin

H4511.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Ammon<SDBH:עַמֹּון>}; ► captured by {L:Jephthah<SDBH:יִפְתָּח>}; possibly known for its wheat

H6436.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = ground grains ► used for food

H1706.def: = sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H6875.def: = dried resin produced by the liquidambar or lentisk terebinth tree; the sticky gray-brown gum is obtained by making cuts in the trunk of the tree; ► aromatic and medicinal, and highly valued in trade with Egypt

H4627.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H6785.def: = soft wavy undercoat of hairy animals such as sheep, ► used to weave a fabric from which clothing was made; ≈ associated with whiteness, purity, and softness

H7070.def: = a tall grass with stiff, sharply-pointed leaves and a plume-like flower head that reaches to more than 2 m; it grows in lakes and streams, the roots creeping across the bottom of the lake to produce new leaves and stalks; or on riverbanks; ◄ Phragmites australis (Common reed) or Arundo donax (Giant reed); ► used for baskets, mats, flutes, pens, arrows, and roof-coverings; ≈ symbol of weakness and undependability, but also flexibility

H2667.def: meaning unsure; probably: = type of cloth; ◄ woven material; ► used as saddle-blanket

H5387.def: = someone in a position of high authority in a clan, tribe, or nation

H6938.def: = man; ◄ second son of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>}; ► founder of ethnic group

H3733.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = a young male sheep

H352.def: = male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat-tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership

H6260.def: = dominant male goat in a {L:צֹאן<SDBH:צֹאן>}; ≈ associated with authority

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1314.def: = tree of 2-3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three-part leaves, white flowers, and pea-sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi-desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume

H3368.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H2771.def: = town; ◄ in northern Mesopotamia; ► place where {L:Abraham's<SDBH:אַבְרָם>} father settled when coming from {L:Ur<SDBH:אוּר>} and where his relatives continued to live; later destroyed by {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; trading partner of {L:Tyre<SDBH:צֹר>}

H7614.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Joktan<SDBH:יָקְטָן>}; descendant of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of ethnic group with the same name

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H7553.def: = cloth with decorative patterns sewn into it by hand and therefore expensive; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H1264.def: = cloth with a variety of colors

H1595.def: = room or place in which valuable items are kept, usually in a temple or palace

H2280.def: = state in which something has been wrapped around part of someone's body

H729.def: meaning unsure; probably: = pertaining to being strong and therefore not easily broken

H591.def: = boat ◄ of a relatively large size ► that is able to sail the sea or ocean

H8659.def: = (semi-)precious stone, possibly kind of beryl, which is colorless in its pure form

H7788.def: = action by which humans move from one place to another

H4627.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H5801.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H4627.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H4419.def: = a person who works as a member of the crew of ship or boat

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H919.def: = state of disrepair of a construction

H6148.def: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4658.def: literally: what has fallen; hence: = the body of a dead animal

H4054.def: = open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats

H2201.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H4880.def: = pole with a flat blade ► used to row or steer a boat through the water

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H591.def: = boat ◄ of a relatively large size ► that is able to sail the sea or ocean

H4419.def: = a person who works as a member of the crew of ship or boat

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H6428.def: = action by which humans turn about in a substance, so that their body or clothing is covered by it

H665.def: = powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

H7139.def: literally: to make bald baldness; hence: = action by which a human being uses a sharp implement to remove the hair on (part of) his scalp, ► as a sign of mourning

H7144.def: = a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning

H2296.def: = state in which someone wears clothes or armor

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H4553.def: = mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H5204.def: = action by which humans sing a mournful song ► to give expression to their grief

H6969.def: = to sing a song in which one expresses one's grief at the loss of a loved one or the destruction of a town or nation

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7015.def: = a sung dirge or lament at the death of a loved one; ◄ death of a friend or family member; ► expression of loss at one's death

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6865.def: = extremely hard type of stone that leaves sharp edges when fractured; ► can be used as knife; ≈ associated with an inflexible attitude

H1822.def: = state in which humans or objects have been removed from existence, through total destruction

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H4627.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H4615.def: = a deep place, usually filled with water; ≈ associated with hardship

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4627.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H339.def: = area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

glosses: to move about freely > to trade
H5503.def: = action of moving from place to place ► to carry out activities of commerce

H1091.def: = something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
